   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_lint_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   26: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   27: -define(datadir, "erl_lint_SUITE_data").
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_lint_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(datadir, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf)).
   33: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   34: -endif.
   35: 
   36: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0]).
   37: 
   38: -export([singleton_type_var_errors/1,
   39:          unused_vars_warn_basic/1,
   40:          unused_vars_warn_lc/1,
   41:          unused_vars_warn_rec/1,
   42:          unused_vars_warn_fun/1,
   43:          unused_vars_OTP_4858/1,
   44:          unused_unsafe_vars_warn/1,
   45:          export_vars_warn/1,
   46:          shadow_vars/1,
   47:          unused_import/1,
   48:          unused_function/1,
   49:          unsafe_vars/1,unsafe_vars2/1,
   50:          unsafe_vars_try/1,
   51:          unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern/1,
   52:          guard/1, otp_4886/1, otp_4988/1, otp_5091/1, otp_5276/1, otp_5338/1,
   53:          otp_5362/1, otp_5371/1, otp_7227/1, binary_aliases/1,
   54:          otp_5494/1, otp_5644/1, otp_5878/1,
   55:          otp_5917/1, otp_6585/1, otp_6885/1, otp_10436/1, otp_11254/1,
   56:          otp_11772/1, otp_11771/1, otp_11872/1,
   57:          export_all/1,
   58:          bif_clash/1,
   59:          behaviour_basic/1, behaviour_multiple/1, otp_11861/1,
   60:          otp_7550/1,
   61:          otp_8051/1,
   62:          format_warn/1,
   63:          on_load_successful/1, on_load_failing/1,
   64:          too_many_arguments/1,
   65:          basic_errors/1,bin_syntax_errors/1,
   66:          predef/1,
   67:          maps/1,maps_type/1,maps_parallel_match/1,
   68:          otp_11851/1,otp_11879/1,otp_13230/1,
   69:          record_errors/1, otp_11879_cont/1,
   70:          non_latin1_module/1, illegal_module_name/1, otp_14323/1,
   71:          stacktrace_syntax/1,
   72:          otp_14285/1, otp_14378/1,
   73:          external_funs/1,otp_15456/1,otp_15563/1,
   74:          unused_type/1,binary_types/1,removed/1, otp_16516/1,
   75:          inline_nifs/1,
   76:          undefined_nifs/1,
   77:          no_load_nif/1,
   78:          warn_missing_spec/1,
   79:          otp_16824/1,
   80:          underscore_match/1,
   81:          unused_record/1,
   82:          unused_type2/1,
   83:          eep49/1,
   84:          redefined_builtin_type/1,
   85:          tilde_k/1,
   86:          match_float_zero/1]).
   87: 
   88: suite() ->
   89:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   90:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   91: 
   92: all() -> 
   93:     [{group, unused_vars_warn}, export_vars_warn,
   94:      shadow_vars, unused_import, unused_function,
   95:      unsafe_vars, unsafe_vars2, unsafe_vars_try, guard,
   96:      unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern,
   97:      otp_4886, otp_4988, otp_5091, otp_5276, otp_5338,
   98:      otp_5362, otp_5371, otp_7227, binary_aliases, otp_5494, otp_5644,
   99:      otp_5878, otp_5917, otp_6585, otp_6885, otp_10436, otp_11254,
  100:      otp_11772, otp_11771, otp_11872, export_all,
  101:      bif_clash, behaviour_basic, behaviour_multiple, otp_11861,
  102:      otp_7550, otp_8051, format_warn, {group, on_load},
  103:      too_many_arguments, basic_errors, bin_syntax_errors, predef,
  104:      maps, maps_type, maps_parallel_match,
  105:      otp_11851, otp_11879, otp_13230,
  106:      record_errors, otp_11879_cont,
  107:      non_latin1_module, illegal_module_name, otp_14323,
  108:      stacktrace_syntax, otp_14285, otp_14378, external_funs,
  109:      otp_15456, otp_15563, unused_type, binary_types, removed, otp_16516,
  110:      undefined_nifs,
  111:      no_load_nif,
  112:      inline_nifs, warn_missing_spec, otp_16824,
  113:      underscore_match, unused_record, unused_type2,
  114:      eep49,
  115:      redefined_builtin_type,
  116:      tilde_k,
  117:      singleton_type_var_errors,
  118:      match_float_zero].
  119: 
  120: groups() -> 
  121:     [{unused_vars_warn, [],
  122:       [unused_vars_warn_basic, unused_vars_warn_lc,
  123:        unused_vars_warn_rec, unused_vars_warn_fun,
  124:        unused_vars_OTP_4858, unused_unsafe_vars_warn]},
  125:      {on_load, [], [on_load_successful, on_load_failing]}].
  126: 
  127: 
  128: %% Warnings for unused variables in some simple cases.
  129: unused_vars_warn_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     Ts = [{basic1,
  131:            <<"f(F) -> % F unused.
  132:                 ok.
  133: 
  134: f(F, F) ->
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: g(_X) ->
  138:     y.
  139: 
  140: h(P) ->
  141:     P.
  142: 
  143: x(N) ->
  144:     case a:b() of
  145: 	[N|Y] -> % Y unused.
  146: 	    ok
  147:     end.
  148: 
  149: y(N, L) ->
  150:     lists:map(fun(T) -> T*N end, L).
  151: 
  152: z(N, L) -> % N unused
  153:     lists:map(fun(N, T) -> T*N end, L).  % N shadowed.
  154: 
  155: 
  156: c(A) ->
  157:     case A of
  158: 	1 -> B = []; % B unused.
  159: 	2 -> B = []; % B unused.
  160: 	3 -> B = f, B
  161:     end.
  162: ">>,
  163: 	   [warn_unused_vars],
  164: {warnings,[{{1,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'F'}},
  165: 	   {{15,5},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  166: 	   {{22,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'N'}},
  167: 	   {{23,19},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'N','fun'}},
  168: 	   {{28,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  169: 	   {{29,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  170:           {basic2,
  171:            <<"-record(r, {x,y}).
  172:               f({X,Y}) -> {Z=X,Z=Y};
  173:               f([H|T]) -> [Z=H|Z=T];
  174:               f(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> #r{x=A=X,y=A=Y}.
  175:               g({M, F}) -> (Z=M):(Z=F)();
  176:               g({M, F, Arg}) -> (Z=M):F(Z=Arg).
  177:               h(X, Y) -> (Z=X) + (Z=Y).">>,
  178:            [warn_unused_vars], []},
  179:           {basic3,
  180:            <<"f(E) ->
  181:                   X = Y = E.">>,
  182:            [warn_unused_vars],
  183:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  184:                       {{2,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}}],
  185:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  186:     ok.
  187: 
  188: %% Warnings for unused variables in list comprehensions.
  189: unused_vars_warn_lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  190:     Ts = [{lc1, 
  191:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  192:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  193:               bin({X}) ->
  194:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  195:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  196:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  197:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  198:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  199:            ">>, 
  200:            [warn_unused_vars],
  201:            {warnings, [{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  202:                        {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  203: 
  204:           {lc2,
  205:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  206:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  207:               bin({X}) ->
  208:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  209:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  210:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  211:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  212:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  213:            ">>,
  214:            [warn_unused_vars],
  215:            {warnings,[{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  216:                       {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  217: 
  218:           {lc3,
  219:            <<"a([A]) ->
  220:                   B = foo,
  221:                   [{C,B} || {C,_} <- A];
  222:               a({A}) ->
  223:                   B = foo,
  224:                   [C || {C,_} <- [B,A]];
  225:               a({A,A}) ->
  226:                   B = foo,
  227:                   [C || {C,_} <- B, B < A].
  228:            ">>,
  229:            [warn_unused_vars],
  230:            []},
  231: 
  232:           {lc4,
  233:            <<"b(A) ->
  234:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  235:                   [C || {C,_} <- A].
  236:            ">>,
  237:            [warn_unused_vars],
  238:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  239: 
  240:           {lc5,
  241:            <<"c(A) ->
  242:                   B = foo,
  243:                   [C || {C,_} <- A],
  244:                   B.
  245:            ">>,
  246:            [warn_unused_vars],
  247:            []},
  248: 
  249:           {lc6,
  250:            <<"d(A) ->
  251:                   B = foo,
  252:                   [{A,B} || {Id,_} <- A]. % Id unused.
  253:            ">>,
  254:            [warn_unused_vars],
  255:            {warnings,[{{3,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Id'}}]}},
  256: 
  257:           {lc7,
  258:            <<"e(A) ->
  259:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  260:                   [B || B <- A]. % B shadowed.
  261:            ">>,
  262:            [warn_unused_vars],
  263:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  264:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  265: 
  266:           {lc8,
  267:            <<"f(A) ->
  268:                   B = foo,
  269:                   [B || B <- A], % B shadowed.
  270:                   B.
  271:            ">>,
  272:            [warn_unused_vars],
  273:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  274: 
  275:           {lc9,
  276:            <<"g(A) ->
  277:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  278:                   [A || B <- A]. % B shadowed, B unused.
  279:            ">>,
  280:            [warn_unused_vars],
  281:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  282:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  283:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  284: 
  285:           {lc10,
  286:            <<"h(A) ->
  287:                   B = foo,
  288:                   [A || B <- A], % B shadowed, B unused.
  289:                   B.
  290:            ">>,
  291:            [warn_unused_vars],
  292:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  293:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  294: 
  295:           {lc11,
  296:            <<"i(X) ->
  297:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  298:                         Z = X <- [foo]]. % X and Z shadowed. X unused!
  299:            ">>,
  300:            [warn_unused_vars],
  301:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  302:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  303:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  304:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  305: 
  306:           {lc12,
  307:            <<"j({X}) ->
  308:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  309:                         Z <- X = [[1,2,3]], % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  310:                         Z <- X, % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  311:                         Z <- X]; % Z shadowed.
  312:               j(X) ->
  313:                   [foo || X <- X, % X shadowed.
  314:                         X <-    % X shadowed. X unused.
  315:                              X =
  316:                                  Y = [[1,2,3]], % Y unused.
  317:                         X <- [], % X shadowed.
  318:                         X <- X]. % X shadowed. X unused.
  319:            ">>,
  320:            [warn_unused_vars],
  321:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  322:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  323:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  324:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  325:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  326:                       {{5,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  327:                       {{7,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  328:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  329:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  330:                       {{10,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  331:                       {{11,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  332:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  333:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  334: 
  335:           {lc13,
  336:            <<"k(X) ->
  337:                   [Z || Z <- Y = X]; % Y unused.
  338:               k(X) ->
  339:                   [Z || Z <- X = Y = X]; % Y unused!
  340:               k(X) ->
  341:                   [Z || Z <- begin X = Y = X, Y end];
  342:               k(X) ->
  343:                   [{Y,W} || W <- Y = X]; % Y unbound
  344:               k(X) ->
  345:                   [Z || Z <- (Y = X), % Y unused.
  346:                        Y > X]; % Y unbound.
  347:               k(X) ->
  348:                   [Y || Y = X > 3, Z = X]; % Z unused.
  349:               k(X) ->
  350:                   [Z || Y = X > 3, Z = X]. % Y unused.
  351:            ">>,
  352:            [warn_unused_vars],
  353:            {error,[{{8,21},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}},
  354:                    {{11,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}}],
  355:                   [{{2,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  356:                    {{4,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  357:                    {{8,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  358:                    {{10,31},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  359:                    {{13,36},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  360:                    {{15,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  361: 
  362:           {lc14,
  363:            <<"lc2() ->
  364:                   Z = [[1],[2],[3]], 
  365:                   [X || Z <- Z, % Z shadowed.
  366:                         X <- Z].
  367:            ">>,
  368:            [warn_unused_vars],
  369:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  370: 
  371:           {lc15,
  372:            <<"lc3() ->
  373:                   Z = [1,2,3], 
  374:                   [X || X <- Z, 
  375:                         Z <- Z]. % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  376:            ">>,
  377:            [warn_unused_vars],
  378:            {warnings,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  379:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  380: 
  381:           {lc16,
  382:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  383:                   case bar of
  384:                       true ->
  385:                           U = 2;
  386:                       false ->
  387:                           true
  388:                   end,
  389:                   case bar of
  390:                       true ->
  391:                           X = 2;
  392:                       false ->
  393:                           X = 3
  394:                   end,
  395:                   case foo of
  396:                       true ->
  397:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  398:                       false ->
  399:                           4
  400:                   end,
  401:                   case foo of
  402:                       1 ->
  403:                           U; % U unsafe.
  404:                       2 ->
  405:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z]; % (X exported.) U unused.
  406:                       3 ->
  407:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  408:                           U % U unsafe.
  409:                   end.
  410:            ">>,
  411:            [warn_unused_vars],
  412:            {error,[{{22,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  413:                    {{27,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}}],
  414:             [{{16,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  415:              {{24,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}},
  416:              {{26,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  417: 
  418:           {lc17,
  419:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  420:                   %% This used to pass erl_lint...
  421:                   case bar of
  422:                       true ->
  423:                           U = 2;
  424:                       false ->
  425:                           true
  426:                   end,
  427:                   case bar of
  428:                       true ->
  429:                           X = 2;
  430:                       false ->
  431:                           X = 3
  432:                   end,
  433:                   case foo of
  434:                       true ->
  435:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  436:                       false ->
  437:                           4
  438:                   end,
  439:                   [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  440:                   U. % U unsafe.
  441:            ">>,
  442:            [warn_unused_vars],
  443:            {error,[{{22,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{3,19}}}}],
  444:             [{{17,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  445:              {{21,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  446: 
  447:           {lc18,
  448:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  449:                   case bar of
  450:                       true ->
  451:                           U = 2;
  452:                       false ->
  453:                           true
  454:                   end,
  455:                   case bar of
  456:                       true ->
  457:                           X = 2;
  458:                       false ->
  459:                           X = 3
  460:                   end,
  461:                   case foo of
  462:                       true ->
  463:                           Y = 3;
  464:                       false ->
  465:                           4
  466:                   end,
  467:                   [B || <<U: % U unused
  468:                           U>> <- X, <<B:Y>> <- Z]. % U unsafe. Y unsafe. 
  469: 						% U shadowed. (X exported.)
  470:            ">>,
  471:            [warn_unused_vars],
  472:            {error,[{{21,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  473:                    {{21,41},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'Y',{'case',{14,19}}}}],
  474:             [{{20,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}
  475:             ]}},
  476: 
  477:           {lc19,
  478:            <<"p({B,C}) ->
  479:                   <<A:B,A:C>> = <<17:32>>;
  480:               p(B) ->
  481:                   <<A:B>> = <<17:32>>. % A unused.
  482:            ">>,
  483:            [warn_unused_vars],
  484:            {warnings,[{{4,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}},
  485: 
  486:           {lc20,
  487:            <<"c({I1,I2}) ->
  488:                   if
  489:                       <<I1:I2>> == <<>> ->
  490:                           foo
  491:                   end;
  492:               c([C1,C2]) -> % C1 unused.
  493:                   case foo of
  494:                       <<C2:C2,
  495:                         C3:C2>> -> % C3 unused.
  496:                           bar
  497:                   end.
  498: 
  499:            ">>,
  500:            [warn_unused_vars],
  501:            {warnings,[{{6,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C1'}},
  502:                       {{7,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  503:                       {{9,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C3'}}]}},
  504: 
  505:           {lc21,
  506:            <<"t() ->
  507:                   S = 8,
  508:                   case <<3:8>> of
  509:                       <<X:S>> ->
  510:                           X;
  511:                       <<S:X>> -> % X unbound
  512:                           foo
  513:                   end;
  514:               t() ->
  515:                   S = 8,
  516:                   case <<3:8>> of
  517:                       <<S:S>> ->
  518:                           S;
  519:                       <<Q:32>> -> % Q unused.
  520:                           foo
  521:                   end.
  522:            ">>,
  523:            [warn_unused_vars],
  524:            {error,[{{6,27},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'X'}}],
  525:                   [{{14,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}}]}}
  526: 
  527:           ],
  528:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  529:     ok.
  530: 
  531: 
  532: %% Warnings for unused variables in records.
  533: unused_vars_warn_rec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  534:     Ts = [{rec1, % An example provided by Bjorn.
  535:            <<"-record(edge,
  536:                       {ltpr,
  537:                        ltsu,
  538:                        rtpr,
  539:                        rtsu
  540:                       }).
  541: 
  542:               f1(#edge{ltpr = A, ltsu = A}) ->
  543:                   true;
  544:               f1({Q, Q}) ->
  545:                   true.
  546: 
  547:               f2(Edge, Etab) ->
  548:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  549:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same,ltsu=Same}} -> ok;
  550:                       {value,_} -> error
  551:                   end.
  552: 
  553:               bar(Edge, Etab) ->
  554:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  555:                       {Same,Same} -> ok;
  556:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same}} -> ok; % Same unused.
  557:                       {value,_} -> error
  558:                   end.
  559:            ">>,
  560:            [warn_unused_vars],
  561:            {warnings,[{{22,41},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Same'}}]}},
  562:           {rec2,
  563:            <<"-record(r, {a,b}).
  564:               f(X, Y) -> #r{a=[K || K <- Y], b=[K || K <- Y]}.
  565:               g(X, Y) -> #r{a=lists:map(fun (K) -> K end, Y),
  566:                             b=lists:map(fun (K) -> K end, Y)}.
  567:               h(X, Y) -> #r{a=case Y of _ when is_list(Y) -> Y end,
  568:                             b=case Y of _ when is_list(Y) -> Y end}.
  569:               i(X, Y) -> #r{a=if is_list(Y) -> Y end, b=if is_list(Y) -> Y end}.
  570:              ">>,
  571:            [warn_unused_vars],
  572:            {warnings,[{{2,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  573:                       {{3,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  574:                       {{5,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  575:                       {{7,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}},
  576:           {rec3,
  577:            <<"-record(r, {a}).
  578:               t() -> X = 1, #r{a=foo, a=bar, a=qux}.
  579:              ">>,
  580:            [warn_unused_vars],
  581:            {error,[{{2,39},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}},
  582:                    {{2,46},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}}],
  583:                   [{{2,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}}],
  584:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  585:     ok.

  869: %% Shadowed variables are tested in other places, but here we test
  870: %% that the warning can be turned off.
  871: shadow_vars(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  872:     Ts = [{shadow1,
  873: 	   <<"bin(A) ->
  874:                   receive
  875:                       M ->
  876:                            X = M,
  877:                            Y = M,
  878:                            Z = M
  879:                   end,
  880:                   [B || <<B:X>> <- A],
  881:                   Y = B,
  882:                   [B || B <- Z]. % B shadowed.
  883:            ">>,
  884: 	   [nowarn_shadow_vars],
  885: 	   {error,[{{9,23},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'B'}}],
  886: 	    [{{9,19},erl_lint,{exported_var,'Y',{'receive',{2,19}}}}]}},
  887:           {shadow2,
  888:            <<"t() ->
  889:                   _ = (catch MS = MS = 1), % MS used unsafe
  890:                   _ = case ok of _ -> fun() -> ok end end,
  891:                   fun (MS) -> MS end. % MS not shadowed here
  892:            ">>,
  893:            [],
  894:            []}],
  895:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  896:     ok.

 1083:            %% Turn off warnings for unused types.
 1084:            {func2,
 1085:            <<"-type foo() :: term().">>,
 1086:            {[nowarn_unused_type]},              %Tuple indicates no export_all
 1087:            []},
 1088: 
 1089:            %% Turn off warnings for unused types using a -compile() directive.
 1090:            {func3,
 1091:            <<"-compile(nowarn_unused_type).
 1092:               -type foo() :: term().">>,
 1093:            {[]},                                %Tuple indicates no export_all
 1094:            []}],
 1095: 
 1096:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 1097:     ok.

 2379: %% OTP-15456. All compiler options can now be given in the option list
 2380: %% (as opposed to only in files).
 2381: otp_15456(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2382:     Ts = [
 2383:           %% {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{M,F,A}]} can now be given
 2384:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2385:           %% Wherever it occurs, it is not affected by
 2386:           %% warn_deprecated_function.
 2387:           {otp_15456_1,
 2388:            <<"-compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,0}}).
 2389:               -export([foo/0]).
 2390: 
 2391:               foo() ->
 2392:                   {erlang:now(), random:seed0(), random:seed(1, 2, 3),
 2393:                    random:uniform(), random:uniform(42)}.
 2394:            ">>,
 2395:            {[{nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,seed0,0}},
 2396:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{random,uniform,0},
 2397:                                           {random,uniform,1}]},
 2398:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2399:              %% turn of warnings for functions that are not
 2400:              %% deprecated or not used in the module.
 2401:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,uniform_s,1}},
 2402:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,abs,1}},
 2403:              warn_deprecated_function]},
 2404:            {warnings,[{{5,50},erl_lint,
 2405:                        {deprecated,{random,seed,3},
 2406:                         "use the 'rand' module instead"}}]}},
 2407: 
 2408:           %% {nowarn_unused_function,[{M,F,A}]} can be given
 2409:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2410:           %% It was incorrectly documented to only work when
 2411:           %% given in an attribute.
 2412:           {otp_15456_2,
 2413:            <<"-compile({nowarn_unused_function,foo/0}).
 2414:               foo() -> ok.
 2415:               bar() -> ok.
 2416:               foobar() -> ok.
 2417:               barf(_) -> ok.
 2418:               other() -> ok.
 2419:            ">>,
 2420:            {[{nowarn_unused_function,[{bar,0},{foobar,0}]},
 2421:              {nowarn_unused_function,{barf,1}},
 2422:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2423:              %% turn of warnings for unused functions that are not
 2424:              %% defined in the module.
 2425:              {nowarn_unused_function,{not_defined_in_module,1}},
 2426:              warn_unused_function]},
 2427:            {warnings,[{{6,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{other,0}}}]}
 2428:           }],
 2429: 
 2430:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2431:     ok.

 2647:              ">>,
 2648:            [warn_unused_record],

 2650:                    {{1,54},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'B'}},

 2652:             [{{1,22},erl_lint,{unused_record,r1}}]}},

 3059: %% Test warnings for functions that clash with BIFs.
 3060: bif_clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3061:     Ts = [{clash1,
 3062:            <<"t(X) ->
 3063:                   size(X).
 3064: 
 3065:               %% No warning for the following calls, since they
 3066:               %% are unambigous.
 3067:               b(X) ->
 3068:                   erlang:size(X).
 3069: 
 3070:               c(X) ->
 3071:                   ?MODULE:size(X).
 3072: 
 3073:               size({N,_}) ->
 3074:                 N.
 3075:              ">>,
 3076:            [],
 3077: 	   {errors,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 3078: 
 3079: 	  %% Verify that warnings cannot be turned off in the old way.
 3080: 	  {clash2,
 3081:            <<"-export([t/1,size/1]).
 3082:               t(X) ->
 3083:                   size(X).
 3084: 
 3085:               size({N,_}) ->
 3086:                 N.
 3087: 
 3088:               %% My own abs/1 function works on lists too. From R14 this really works.
 3089:               abs([H|T]) when $a =< H, H =< $z -> [H-($a-$A)|abs(T)];
 3090:               abs([H|T]) -> [H|abs(T)];
 3091:               abs([]) -> [];
 3092:               abs(X) -> erlang:abs(X).
 3093:              ">>,
 3094: 	   {[nowarn_unused_function,nowarn_bif_clash]},
 3095: 	   {errors,[{erl_lint,disallowed_nowarn_bif_clash}],[]}},
 3096: 	  %% As long as noone calls an overridden BIF, it's totally OK
 3097: 	  {clash3,
 3098:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3099:               size({N,_}) ->
 3100:                 N;
 3101:               size(X) ->
 3102:                 erlang:size(X).
 3103:              ">>,
 3104: 	   [],
 3105: 	   []},
 3106: 	  %% But this is totally wrong - meaning of the program changed in R14, so this is an error
 3107: 	  {clash4,
 3108:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3109:               size({N,_}) ->
 3110:                 N;
 3111:               size(X) ->
 3112:                 size(X).
 3113:              ">>,
 3114: 	   [],
 3115: 	   {errors,[{{5,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 3116: 	  %% For a post R14 bif, its only a warning
 3117: 	  {clash5,
 3118:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).
 3119:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3120:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3121:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3122:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3123:              ">>,
 3124: 	   [],
 3125: 	   {warnings,[{{3,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_bif,{binary_part,2}}}]}},
 3126: 	  %% If you really mean to call yourself here, you can "unimport" size/1
 3127: 	  {clash6,
 3128:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3129:               -compile({no_auto_import,[size/1]}).
 3130:               size([]) ->
 3131:                 0;
 3132:               size({N,_}) ->
 3133:                 N;
 3134:               size([_|T]) ->
 3135:                 1+size(T).
 3136:              ">>,
 3137: 	   [],
 3138: 	   []},
 3139: 	  %% Same for the post R14 autoimport warning
 3140: 	  {clash7,
 3141:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).
 3142:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3143:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3144:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3145:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3146:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3147:              ">>,
 3148: 	   [],
 3149: 	   []},
 3150:           %% but this doesn't mean the local function is allowed in a guard...
 3151: 	  {clash8,
 3152:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3153:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3154:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>> ->
 3155:                  hej.
 3156:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3157:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3158:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3159:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3160:              ">>,
 3161: 	   [],
 3162: 	   {errors,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3163:           %% no_auto_import is not like nowarn_bif_clash, it actually removes the autoimport
 3164: 	  {clash9,
 3165:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3166:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3167:               x(X) ->
 3168:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3169:              ">>,
 3170: 	   [],
 3171: 	   {errors,[{{4,18},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3172:           %% but we could import it again...
 3173: 	  {clash10,
 3174:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3175:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3176:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3177:               x(X) ->
 3178:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3179:              ">>,
 3180: 	   [],
 3181: 	   []},
 3182:           %% and actually use it in a guard...
 3183: 	  {clash11,
 3184:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3185:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3186:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3187:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3188:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3189:              ">>,
 3190: 	   [],
 3191: 	   []},
 3192:           %% but for non-obvious historical reasons, imported functions cannot be used in
 3193: 	  %% fun construction without the module name...
 3194: 	  {clash12,
 3195:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3196:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3197:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3198:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3199:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3200:              ">>,
 3201: 	   [],
 3202: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3203:           %% Not from erlang and not from anywhere else
 3204: 	  {clash13,
 3205:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3206:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3207:               -import(x,[binary_part/2]).
 3208:               x(X) ->
 3209:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3210:              ">>,
 3211: 	   [],
 3212: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3213: 	  %% ...while real auto-import is OK.
 3214: 	  {clash14,
 3215:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3216:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3217:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3218:              ">>,
 3219: 	   [],
 3220: 	   []},
 3221:           %% Import directive clashing with old bif is an error, regardless of if it's called or not
 3222: 	  {clash15,
 3223:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3224:               -import(x,[abs/1]).
 3225:               x(X) ->
 3226:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}).
 3227:              ">>,
 3228: 	   [],
 3229: 	   {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_old_bif_import,{abs,1}}}],[]}},
 3230: 	  %% For a new BIF, it's only a warning
 3231: 	  {clash16,
 3232:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3233:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3234:               x(X) ->
 3235:                  abs(X).
 3236:              ">>,
 3237: 	   [],
 3238: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3239: 	  %% And, you cannot redefine already imported things that aren't auto-imported
 3240: 	  {clash17,
 3241:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3242:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3243:               -import(y,[binary_port/3]).
 3244:               x(X) ->
 3245:                  abs(X).
 3246:              ">>,
 3247: 	   [],
 3248: 	   {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_import,{{binary_port,3},x}}}],[]}},
 3249: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3250: 	  {clash18,
 3251:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3252:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3253:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3254:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3255:               x(X) ->
 3256:                  abs(X).
 3257:              ">>,
 3258: 	   [],
 3259: 	   {errors,[{{3,15},erl_lint,{define_import,{binary_port,3}}}],[]}},
 3260: 	  %% Like clash8: Dont accept a guard if it's explicitly module-name called either
 3261: 	  {clash19,
 3262:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3263:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/3]}).
 3264:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3265:               binary_port(A,B,C) when x:binary_part(A,B,C) ->
 3266:                  binary_part(A,B,C+1).
 3267:              ">>,
 3268: 	   [],
 3269: 	   {errors,[{{4,39},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr}],[]}},
 3270: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3271: 	  {clash20,
 3272:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3273:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3274:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3275:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3276:              ">>,
 3277: 	   [warn_unused_import],
 3278: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3279: 	  %% Don't accept call to a guard BIF if there is a local definition
 3280: 	  %% or an import with the same name. Note: is_record/2 is an
 3281: 	  %% exception, since it is more of syntatic sugar than a real BIF.
 3282: 	  {clash21,
 3283:            <<"-export([is_list/1]).
 3284:               -import(x, [is_tuple/1]).
 3285:               -record(r, {a,b}).
 3286:               x(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 3287:               x(T) when is_list(T) -> ok.
 3288:               y(T) when is_tuple(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3289:               y(T) when is_list(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3290:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) -> ok;
 3291:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) =:= true -> ok;
 3292:               y(T) when is_record(T, r) =:= true -> ok.
 3293:               is_list(_) ->
 3294:                 ok.
 3295:               is_record(_, _) ->
 3296:                 ok.
 3297:               is_record(_, _, _) ->
 3298:                 ok.
 3299:              ">>,
 3300: 	   [{no_auto_import,[{is_tuple,1}]}],
 3301: 	   {errors,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3302: 		    {{5,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3303: 		    {{6,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3304: 		    {{7,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3305: 		    {{8,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}},
 3306: 		    {{9,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}}],[]}},
 3307: 	  %% We can also suppress all auto imports at once
 3308: 	  {clash22,
 3309:           <<"-export([size/1, binary_part/2]).
 3310:              -compile(no_auto_import).
 3311:              size([]) ->
 3312:                0;
 3313:              size({N,_}) ->
 3314:                N;
 3315:              size([_|T]) ->
 3316:                1+size(T).
 3317:              binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3318:                binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3319:              binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3320:                binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3321:             ">>,
 3322: 	   [],
 3323: 	   []}
 3324: 	 ],
 3325: 
 3326:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3327:     ok.

 3463:     CallbackFiles = [callback1, callback2, callback3,
 3464:                      bad_behaviour1, bad_behaviour2],
 3465:     lists:foreach(fun(M) ->
 3466:                           F = filename:join(?datadir, M),
 3467:                           Opts = [{outdir,?privdir}, return],
 3468:                           {ok, M, []} = compile:file(F, Opts)
 3469:                   end, CallbackFiles),
 3470:     CodePath = code:get_path(),
 3471:     true = code:add_path(?privdir),
 3472:     Ts = [{otp_11861_1,
 3473:            <<"

 3475:               -behaviour(callback1).

 3480:                   3.
 3481:              ">>,
 3482:            [],

 3485:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b1,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3486:           {otp_11861_2,
 3487:            <<"
 3488:               -export([b2/1]).
 3489:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3490:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3491:

 3493:               b2(I) when is_integer(I)->
 3494:                   a.
 3495:              ">>,
 3496:            [],
 3497:            %% b2/1 is optional in callback2, but not in callback1
 3498:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{b1,1},callback1}},
 3499:                       {{4,16},erl_lint,
 3500:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b2,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},

 3519:              ">>,

 3523:           {otp_11861_6,

 3646: %% Test that the new utf8/utf16/utf32 types do not allow size or
 3647: %% unit specifiers.

 3649:     Ts = [{otp_7550,
 3650:            <<"f8(A) ->
 3651:                   <<A:8/utf8>>.
 3652:               g8(A) ->
 3653:                   <<A:8/utf8-unit:1>>.
 3654:               h8(A) ->
 3655:                   <<A/utf8-unit:1>>.
 3656: 
 3657:               f16(A) ->
 3658:                   <<A:8/utf16>>.
 3659:               g16(A) ->
 3660:                   <<A:8/utf16-unit:1>>.
 3661:               h16(A) ->
 3662:                   <<A/utf16-unit:1>>.
 3663: 
 3664:               f32(A) ->
 3665:                   <<A:8/utf32>>.
 3666:               g32(A) ->
 3667:                   <<A:8/utf32-unit:1>>.
 3668:               h32(A) ->
 3669:                   <<A/utf32-unit:1>>.
 3670:              ">>,
 3671:            [],
 3672:            {errors,[{{2,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3673: 		    {{4,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3674: 		    {{6,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3675: 		    {{9,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3676: 		    {{11,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3677: 		    {{13,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3678: 		    {{16,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3679: 		    {{18,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3680: 		    {{20,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit}
 3681: 		   ],

 3687: %% Bugfix: -opaque with invalid type.
 3688: otp_8051(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3689:     Ts = [{otp_8051,
 3690:            <<"-opaque foo() :: bar().
 3691:               -export_type([foo/0]).
 3692:              ">>,

 3696:     ok.
 3697: 
 3698: %% Check that format warnings are generated.
 3699: format_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3700:     L1 = 16,
 3701:     L2 = 5,
 3702:     format_level(1, L1, Config),
 3703:     format_level(2, L1+L2, Config),
 3704:     format_level(3, L1+L2, Config),             %there is no level 3
 3705:     ok.
 3706: 
 3707: format_level(Level, Count, Config) ->
 3708:     W = get_compilation_result(Config, "format",
 3709:                                      [{warn_format, Level}]),
 3710:     %% Pick out the 'format' warnings.
 3711:     FW = lists:filter(fun({_Line, erl_lint, {format_error, _}}) -> true;
 3712:                                (_) -> false
 3713:                             end,
 3714:                             W),
 3715:     case length(FW) of
 3716:               Count ->
 3717:                   ok;
 3718:               Other ->
 3719:                   io:format("Expected ~w warning(s); got ~w", [Count,Other]),
 3720:                   fail()
 3721:           end,
 3722:     ok.
 3723:

 3725:

 3728:     Ts = [{on_load_1,
 3729: 	   %% Exported on_load function.

 3731:              -on_load(do_on_load/0).

 3733:              ">>,

 3742: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3743: 	   []},

 3753: 	   []}

 4214: %% OTP-11879: The -spec f/a :: (As) -> B; syntax removed,
 4215: %% and is_subtype/2 deprecated.
 4216: otp_11879(_Config) ->
 4217:     Fs = [{attribute,0,file,{"file.erl",0}},
 4218:           {attribute,0,module,m},
 4219:           {attribute,1,spec,
 4220:            {{f,1},
 4221:             [{type,2,'fun',[{type,3,product,[{var,4,'V1'},
 4222:                                              {var,5,'V1'}]},
 4223:                             {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}},
 4224:           {attribute,20,callback,
 4225:            {{cb,21},
 4226:             [{type,22,'fun',[{type,23,product,[{var,24,'V1'},
 4227:                                                {var,25,'V1'}]},
 4228:                              {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}}],
 4229:     {error,[{"file.erl",
 4230:              [{1,erl_lint,{spec_fun_undefined,{f,1}}},
 4231:               {2,erl_lint,spec_wrong_arity},
 4232:               {22,erl_lint,callback_wrong_arity}]}],
 4233:      []} = compile_forms(Fs, [return,report]),
 4234:     ok.
 4235: 
 4236: compile_forms(Terms, Opts) ->
 4237:     Forms = [erl_parse:anno_from_term(Term) || Term <- Terms],
 4238:     compile:forms(Forms, Opts).
 4239:

 4241: otp_13230(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4242:     Abstr = <<"-deprecated([{frutt,0,next_version}]).">>,
 4243:     {errors,[{{1,2},erl_lint,undefined_module},
 4244:              {{1,2},erl_lint,{bad_deprecated,{frutt,0}}}],
 4245:      []} = run_test2(Config, Abstr, []),
 4246:     ok.

 4255:            {errors,[{{2,36},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}},
 4256: 		    {{3,35},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}}],[]}}],
 4257:     run(Config, Ts).
 4258: 
 4259: otp_11879_cont(Config) ->

 4308: %% OTP-14285: We currently don't support non-latin1 module names.
 4309: 
 4310: non_latin1_module(Config) ->
 4311:     Expected = [non_latin1_module_unsupported],
 4312:     Expected = check_module_name('юникод'),
 4313:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([256,$a,$b,$c])),
 4314:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([$a,$b,256,$c])),
 4315: 
 4316:     "module names with non-latin1 characters are not supported" =
 4317:         format_error(non_latin1_module_unsupported),
 4318:     BadCallback =
 4319:         {bad_callback,{'кирилли́ческий атом','кирилли́ческий атом',0}},
 4320:     BadModule =
 4321:         {bad_module,{'кирилли́ческий атом','кирилли́ческий атом',0}},
 4322:     "explicit module not allowed for callback "
 4323:     "'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'/0" =
 4324:         format_error(BadCallback),
 4325:     UndefBehav = {undefined_behaviour,'кирилли́ческий атом'},
 4326:     "behaviour 'кирилли́ческий атом' undefined" =
 4327:         format_error(UndefBehav),
 4328:     Ts = [{non_latin1_module,
 4329:            <<"
 4330:             %% Report uses of module names with non-Latin-1 characters.
 4331: 
 4332:             -import('кирилли́ческий атом', []).
 4333:             -behaviour('кирилли́ческий атом').
 4334:             -behavior('кирилли́ческий атом').
 4335: 
 4336:             -callback 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'() -> a.
 4337: 
 4338:             %% erl_lint:gexpr/3 is not extended to check module name here:
 4339:             t1() when 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'(1) ->
 4340:                 b.
 4341: 
 4342:             t2() ->
 4343:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'().
 4344: 
 4345:             -spec 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'() -> atom().
 4346: 
 4347:             -spec 'кирилли́ческий атом'(integer()) ->
 4348:               'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'().
 4349: 
 4350:             'кирилли́ческий атом'(1) ->
 4351:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':f(),
 4352:                 F = f,
 4353:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':F()."/utf8>>,
 4354:            [],
 4355:            {error,
 4356:             [{{4,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4357:              {{5,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4358:              {{6,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4359:              {{8,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4360:              {{8,14},erl_lint,BadCallback},
 4361:              {{11,23},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr},
 4362:              {{15,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4363:              {{17,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4364:              {{17,14},erl_lint,BadModule},
 4365:              {{20,15},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4366:              {{23,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4367:              {{25,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported}],
 4368:             [{{5,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav},
 4369:              {{6,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav}]}}],
 4370:     run(Config, Ts),
 4371:     ok.
 4372: 
 4373: illegal_module_name(_Config) ->
 4374:     [empty_module_name] = check_module_name(''),
 4375: 
 4376:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x00'),
 4377:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x1F'),
 4378:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x7F'),
 4379:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80'),
 4380:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80xyz'),
 4381:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x9Fxyz'),
 4382: 
 4383:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name,
 4384:      non_latin1_module_unsupported] = check_module_name('атом\x00'),
 4385: 
 4386:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name(' '),
 4387:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xA0'),
 4388:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xAD'),
 4389:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('  \xA0\xAD '),
 4390: 
 4391:     %% White space and soft hyphens are OK if there are visible
 4392:     %% characters in the name.
 4393:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4394:     ok = check_module_name('abc '),
 4395:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4396:     ok = check_module_name(' abc xyz '),
 4397:     ok = check_module_name(' abc\xADxyz '),
 4398: 
 4399:     ok.
 4400: 
 4401: check_module_name(Mod) ->
 4402:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 4403:     L1 = erl_anno:new(1),
 4404:     Forms = [{attribute,L1,file,{File,1}},
 4405:              {attribute,L1,module,Mod},
 4406:              {eof,2}],
 4407:     _ = compile:forms(Forms),
 4408:     case compile:forms(Forms, [return]) of
 4409:         {error,Errors,[]} ->
 4410:             [{_ModName,L}] = Errors,
 4411:             lists:sort([Reason || {1,erl_lint,Reason} <- L]);
 4412:         {ok,Mod,Code,Ws} when is_binary(Code), is_list(Ws)  ->
 4413:             ok
 4414:     end.
 4415: 
 4416: otp_14378(Config) ->
 4417:     Ts = [
 4418:           {otp_14378_1,
 4419:            <<"-export([t/0]).
 4420:               -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,1}}).
 4421:               t() ->
 4422:                  erlang:now().">>,
 4423:            [],
 4424:            {warnings,[{{4,18},erl_lint,
 4425:                        {deprecated,{erlang,now,0},
 4426:                         "see the \"Time and Time Correction in Erlang\" "
 4427:                         "chapter of the ERTS User's Guide for more "
 4428:                         "information"}}]}}],
 4429:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 4430:     ok.

 4483:                   try error(foo)

 4485:                   end.

 4491:                   Stk = [],
 4492:                   try error(foo)
 4493:                   catch _:_:Stk -> ok
 4494:                   end.
 4495:            ">>,
 4496:            [],
 4497:            {errors,[{{4,29},erl_lint,{stacktrace_bound,'Stk'}}],[]}},
 4498:           {bound_in_pattern,
 4499:            <<"t1() ->
 4500:                   try error(foo)
 4501:                   catch _:{x,T}:T -> ok
 4502:                   end.
 4503:            ">>,
 4504:            [],

 4625: one_multi_init(Config) ->
 4626:     "'_' initializes no omitted fields" =
 4627:         format_error(bad_multi_field_init),
 4628:     Ts = [{otp_16516_1,
 4629:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4630:               t(#r{f = 17, _ = V}) ->
 4631:                   V.
 4632:               u(#r{_ = V, f = 17}) ->
 4633:                   V.
 4634:               -record(r1, {f, g = 17}).
 4635:               g(#r1{f = 3, _ = 42}) ->
 4636:                 g.
 4637:              ">>,
 4638:            [],
 4639:            {errors,[{{2,28},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4640:                     {{4,20},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init}],[]}},
 4641:           {otp_16516_2,
 4642:            %% No error since "_ = '_'" is actually used as a catch-all
 4643:            %% initialization. V is unused (as compilation with the 'E'
 4644:            %% option shows), but no warning about V being unused is
 4645:            %% output.
 4646:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4647:               t(V) ->
 4648:                   #r{f = 3, _ = V}.
 4649:               u(V) ->
 4650:                   #r{_ = V, f = 3}.
 4651:              ">>,
 4652:            [],
 4653:            []},
 4654:           {otp_16516_3,
 4655:            %% No error in this case either. And no unused variable warning.
 4656:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4657:               t(V) when #r{f = 3, _ = V} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4658:                   a.
 4659:               u(V) when #r{_ = V, f = 3} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4660:                   a.
 4661:              ">>,
 4662:            [],
 4663:            []}],
 4664:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 4665:

 4673:                    _ = V2}) ->
 4674:                   {V1, V2}.

 4676:                   V1.
 4677:              ">>,
 4678:            [],

 4760: warn_missing_spec(Config) ->
 4761:     Test = <<"-export([external_with_spec/0, external_no_spec/0]).
 4762: 
 4763:               -spec external_with_spec() -> ok.
 4764:               external_with_spec() -> ok.
 4765: 
 4766:               external_no_spec() -> ok.
 4767: 
 4768:               -spec internal_with_spec() -> ok.
 4769:               internal_with_spec() -> ok.
 4770: 
 4771:               internal_no_spec() -> ok.">>,
 4772: 
 4773:     %% Be sure to avoid adding export_all using the option-list-in-a-tuple trick.
 4774:     {warnings, [{{6,15}, erl_lint, {missing_spec, {external_no_spec, 0}}}]} =
 4775:         run_test(Config, Test, {[warn_missing_spec, nowarn_unused_function]}),

 5148:                   io:format(\"~kp\n\", [Map]),
 5149:                   io:format(\"~kP\n\", [Map,10]),
 5150:                   io:format(\"~kw\n\", [Map]),
 5151:                   io:format(\"~kW\n\", [Map,5]),

 5154:                   RevCmpFun = fun erlang:'>='/2,
 5155:                   io:format(\"~Kp\n\", [RevCmpFun,Map]),
 5156:                   io:format(\"~KP\n\", [RevCmpFun,Map,10]),
 5157:                   io:format(\"~Kw\n\", [RevCmpFun,Map]),
 5158:                   io:format(\"~KW\n\", [RevCmpFun,Map,5]),
 5159:                   ok.">>,
 5160:            [],
 5161:            []},
 5162:           {tilde_k_2,
 5163:            <<"t(Map) ->
 5164:                   io:format(\"~kkp\n\", [Map]),
 5165:                   io:format(\"~kKp\n\", [Map]),

 5168:            [],
 5169:            {warnings,

 5172:               {format_error,{"format string invalid (~ts)",
 5173:                              ["repeated modifier k"]}}},

 5176:               {format_error,{"format string invalid (~ts)",
 5177:                              ["conflicting modifiers ~Kkp"]}}},

 5188: match_float_zero(Config) ->
 5189:     Ts = [{float_zero_1,
 5190:            <<"t(+0.0) -> ok.\n"
 5191:              "k(-0.0) -> ok.\n">>,
 5192:            [],
 5193:            []},

 5196:              "k({0.0}) -> ok.\n">>,
 5197:            [],
 5198:            {warnings,[{{1,23},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5199:                       {{2,4},erl_lint,match_float_zero}]}},
 5200:           {float_zero_3,
 5201:            <<"t(A) when A =:= 0.0 -> ok;\n" %% Should warn.
 5202:              "t(A) when A =:= {0.0} -> ok.\n" %% Should warn.
 5203:              "k(A) -> A =:= 0.0.\n" %% Should warn.
 5204:              "q(A) -> A =:= {0.0}.\n" %% Should warn.
 5205:              "z(A) when A =:= +0.0 -> ok;\n" %% Should not warn.
 5206:              "z(A) when A =:= {+0.0} -> ok.\n">>, %% Should not warn.
 5207:            [],
 5208:            {warnings,[{{1,37},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5209:                       {{2,18},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5210:                       {{3,15},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5211:                       {{4,16},erl_lint,match_float_zero}]}}
 5212:          ],

 5216: 
 5217: %%%
 5218: %%% Common utilities.
 5219: %%%
 5220: 
 5221: format_error(E) ->
 5222:     lists:flatten(erl_lint:format_error(E)).
 5223: 
 5224: run(Config, Tests) ->
 5225:     F = fun({N,P,Ws,E}, BadL) ->
 5226:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 5227:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Ws) of
 5228:                     E -> 
 5229:                         BadL;
 5230:                     Bad -> 
 5231:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 5232:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Bad]),
 5233: 			fail()
 5234:                 end
 5235:         end,
 5236:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 5237: 
 5238: %% Compiles a test file and returns the list of warnings/errors.
 5239: 
 5240: get_compilation_result(Conf, Filename, Warnings) ->
 5241:     DataDir = ?datadir,
 5242:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 5243:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File++".erl"),
 5244:     FileS = binary_to_list(Bin),
 5245:     {match,[{Start,Length}|_]} = re:run(FileS, "-module.*\\n"),
 5246:     Test = lists:nthtail(Start+Length, FileS),
 5247:     case run_test(Conf, Test, Warnings) of
 5248:         {warnings, Ws} -> Ws;
 5249:         {errors,Es,Ws} -> {Es,Ws};
 5250:         [] -> []
 5251:     end.
 5252: 
 5253: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 5254: 
 5255: run_test(Conf, Test0, Warnings0) ->
 5256:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(lint_test). ", Test0]),
 5257:     run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0).
 5258: 
 5259: run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0) ->
 5260:     Filename = "lint_test.erl",
 5261:     DataDir = ?privdir,
 5262:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 5263:     Opts = case Warnings0 of
 5264:                {Warnings} ->		%Hairy trick to not add export_all.
 5265:                    [return|Warnings];
 5266:                Warnings ->
 5267:                    [export_all,return|Warnings]
 5268:            end,
 5269:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 5270: 
 5271:     %% We will use the 'binary' option so that the compiler will not
 5272:     %% compare the module name to the output file name. Also, there
 5273:     %% is no reason to produce an output file since we are only
 5274:     %% interested in the errors and warnings.
 5275: 
 5276:     %% Print warnings, call erl_lint:format_error/1. (But note that
 5277:     %% the compiler will ignore failing calls to erl_lint:format_error/1.)
 5278:     compile:file(File, [binary,report|Opts]),
 5279: 
 5280:     case compile:file(File, [binary|Opts]) of
 5281:         {ok, _M, Code, Ws} when is_binary(Code) ->
 5282:             warnings(File, Ws, Test);
 5283:         {error, [{File,Es}], []} ->
 5284:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 5285: 	    {errors, call_format_error(Es), []};
 5286:         {error, [{File,Es}], [{File,Ws}]} ->
 5287:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 5288:             print_diagnostics(Ws, Test),
 5289: 	    {error, call_format_error(Es), call_format_error(Ws)};
 5290:         {error, [{File,Es1},{File,Es2}], []} ->
 5291:             print_diagnostics(Es1, Test),
 5292:             print_diagnostics(Es2, Test),
 5293: 	    {errors2, Es1, Es2}
 5294:     end.
 5295: 
 5296: warnings(File, Ws, Source) ->
 5297:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 5298:         [] ->
 5299: 	    [];
 5300:         L ->
 5301:             print_diagnostics(L, Source),
 5302: 	    {warnings, call_format_error(L)}
 5303:     end.
 5304: 
 5305: call_format_error(L) ->
 5306:     %% Smoke test of format_error/1 to make sure that no crashes
 5307:     %% slip through.
 5308:     _ = [Mod:format_error(Term) || {_,Mod,Term} <- L],
 5309:     L.
 5310: 
 5311: print_diagnostics(Warnings, Source) ->
 5312:     case binary:match(Source, <<"-file(">>) of
 5313:         nomatch ->
 5314:             Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 5315:             Cs = [print_diagnostic(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 5316:             io:put_chars(Cs);
 5317:         _ ->
 5318:             %% There are probably fake line numbers greater than
 5319:             %% the number of actual lines.
 5320:             ok
 5321:     end.
 5322: 
 5323: print_diagnostic({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 5324:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 5325:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 5326:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 5327:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 5328:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n", [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 5329:      Line0, "\n",
 5330:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 5331: print_diagnostic(_, _) ->
 5332:     [].
 5333: 
 5334: fail() ->
 5335:     ct:fail(failed).
